title: Torodora chlorobapta
text:
Torodora chlorobapta is a <a href="moth">moth</a> in the family <a href="Lecithoceridae">Lecithoceridae</a>. It was described by <a href="Edward%20Meyrick">Edward Meyrick</a> in 1931. It is found in <a href="Sikkim">Sikkim</a>, <a href="India">India</a>.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is about 17 mm. The forewings are dark violet fuscous. The stigmata are black, the plical and first discal moderately large, the plical rather anterior, the second discal dot-like, an additional dot beneath it. There is a pale ochreous terminal band of even width, sprinkled fuscous except along the sinuate anterior edge. The hindwings are pale grey.
